title: CES 2025 Brings Exciting Anker Smart Home Devices & Speakers
description: Anker is releasing products across multiple brands at CES 2025. Expect new tech including chargers, speakers, and smart home devices.
author: Irene Okpanachi
excerpt: Anker is releasing products across multiple brands at CES 2025. Expect new tech including chargers, speakers, and smart home devices.
text: If you're following CES 2025, Anker has a lot in store for you. They’re releasing products across their Anker, Soundcore, and eufy brands. Among them is the 140W charger with a real-time display and a 25,000mAh power bank that can charge your laptop. Interestingly, the brand has also introduced new smart home devices. Here's more information about the devices and how you can get them. Charge into 2025 With power, sound, and portability CES 2025 is already shaping up to be a showcase of groundbreaking tech, and one company that's consistently been in the spotlight is Anker. This year, the brand has expanded its presence beyond power banks and charging solutions into smart home devices, sustainable tech, and connectivity tools. At CES 2024, Anker revealed their GaNPrime chargers and wireless charging systems. This year, expectations are higher that Anker will once again push boundaries. Here are their presentations for the event: Anker SOLIX EverFrost 2 Cooler Image: Anker Pricing$699 (23L), $749 (40L), $999 (58L)Pre-ordersFebruary 21 (40L and 58L)Retail availabilityMarch 7, 2025General availabilityMarch 10, 2025 The Anker SOLIX EverFrost Electric Cooler comes in three sizes: 23L, 40L, and 58L. The largest 58L size has two separate compartments, so you can freeze one part while cooling the other. You can set the temperature anywhere from -4°F to 68°F. Anker boasts that the cooler’s 360° air-cooling process makes it 30% faster than other coolers that use direct cooling. With two 288Wh LFP batteries, it can last up to 104 hours of cooling. If you only use one battery, it lasts up to 52 hours. The batteries can also charge other devices through USB-C and USB-A ports, which is pretty impressive. The cooler itself can be powered in four ways: through solar power (100W), AC, a car socket, or USB-C. It also has 6-inch wheels to move it around, and it supports solar recharging. Related: Anker Prime Power Bank Review Anker Soundcore Rave 3S Image: Anker Pricing$349AvailabilityMarch 10, 2025 The Anker Soundcore Rave 3S offers 200W sound output, enough to deliver loud and clear audio to fill a large room or an outdoor space around 1,076 square feet. It also features a beat-synced light show that turns any space into a party zone. More importantly, there's an AI karaoke functionality that does vocal removal, vocal enhancement, and reverb.  The speaker separates vocals from the music, so you get just the instrumental to sing along. When you use the two wireless microphones, it enhances your voice, and then adds a reverb effect to make your singing sound more professional. In addition, the speaker promises 12-hour playtime, IPX4 water resistance, spatial audio mode, and Auracast. Soundcore Boom 2 Pro Image: Anker Price$249AvailabilityApril 25, 2025 The Soundcore Boom 2 Pro is another speaker with a handle and 140W output reaching as low as 40Hz. It's IP68-rated and has strong protection from water and dust. It also has an RGB light show that syncs to your music and adds visual hype to its 20-hour playtime. Anker SOLIX Solar Beach Umbrella Image: Anker PricingYet to be determined.AvailabilityExpected Summer 2025 This solar beach umbrella doesn’t ask too much of you when you go to the beach. You simply set it up, and it does the work. As you enjoy the sun or surf, it quietly absorbs solar energy to charge your devices or power a small light without you having to worry about extra cords, power banks, or finding outlets. It provides shade, keeps your gadgets powered, and all you have to do is relax. Anker hasn't announced the exact price and release date for the product, but we should expect more details around Summer of 2025 Eufy Robot Vacuum 3-in-1 E20  Image: Anker Pricing$549.99Presale$50 off (January 7 – February 9)AvailabilityFebruary 10, 2025 The eufy Robot Vacuum 3-in-1 E20 uses sensors to navigate and map your home, avoiding obstacles and cleaning efficiently. It auto-empties itself and integrates with a mobile app to give you more control. The vacuum will be available for purchase starting February 10, 2025. However, a presale event is already open on the Eufy Store until February 9, when you can get $50 off the regular price. Irene is an experienced writer with four years in the Tech, E-commerce, and Food niches. She currently writes for Talk Android and Android Police, where she geeks out about the latest innovative practices, solutions, and gadgets. When not writing, Irene embraces her inner couch potato, finding joy in gaming, singing, music, and of course, eating.
html:
If you're following CES 2025, Anker has a lot in store for you. They’re releasing products across their Anker, Soundcore, and eufy brands. Among them is the 140W charger with a real-time display and a 25,000mAh power bank that can charge your laptop. Interestingly, the brand has also introduced new smart home devices. Here's more information about the devices and how you can get them.

Charge into 2025 With power, sound, and portability

CES 2025 is already shaping up to be a showcase of groundbreaking tech, and one company that's consistently been in the spotlight is Anker. This year, the brand has expanded its presence beyond power banks and charging solutions into smart home devices, sustainable tech, and connectivity tools.

At CES 2024, Anker revealed their GaNPrime chargers and wireless charging systems. This year, expectations are higher that Anker will once again push boundaries. Here are their presentations for the event:

Anker SOLIX EverFrost 2 Cooler

The Anker SOLIX EverFrost Electric Cooler comes in three sizes: 23L, 40L, and 58L. The largest 58L size has two separate compartments, so you can freeze one part while cooling the other. You can set the temperature anywhere from -4°F to 68°F. Anker boasts that the cooler’s 360° air-cooling process makes it 30% faster than other coolers that use direct cooling.

With two 288Wh LFP batteries, it can last up to 104 hours of cooling. If you only use one battery, it lasts up to 52 hours. The batteries can also charge other devices through USB-C and USB-A ports, which is pretty impressive. The cooler itself can be powered in four ways: through solar power (100W), AC, a car socket, or USB-C. It also has 6-inch wheels to move it around, and it supports solar recharging.

Related: Anker Prime Power Bank Review

Anker Soundcore Rave 3S

The Anker Soundcore Rave 3S offers 200W sound output, enough to deliver loud and clear audio to fill a large room or an outdoor space around 1,076 square feet. It also features a beat-synced light show that turns any space into a party zone. More importantly, there's an AI karaoke functionality that does vocal removal, vocal enhancement, and reverb. 

The speaker separates vocals from the music, so you get just the instrumental to sing along. When you use the two wireless microphones, it enhances your voice, and then adds a reverb effect to make your singing sound more professional. In addition, the speaker promises 12-hour playtime, IPX4 water resistance, spatial audio mode, and Auracast.

Soundcore Boom 2 Pro

The Soundcore Boom 2 Pro is another speaker with a handle and 140W output reaching as low as 40Hz. It's IP68-rated and has strong protection from water and dust. It also has an RGB light show that syncs to your music and adds visual hype to its 20-hour playtime.

Anker SOLIX Solar Beach Umbrella

This solar beach umbrella doesn’t ask too much of you when you go to the beach. You simply set it up, and it does the work. As you enjoy the sun or surf, it quietly absorbs solar energy to charge your devices or power a small light without you having to worry about extra cords, power banks, or finding outlets.

It provides shade, keeps your gadgets powered, and all you have to do is relax. Anker hasn't announced the exact price and release date for the product, but we should expect more details around Summer of 2025

Eufy Robot Vacuum 3-in-1 E20 

The eufy Robot Vacuum 3-in-1 E20 uses sensors to navigate and map your home, avoiding obstacles and cleaning efficiently. It auto-empties itself and integrates with a mobile app to give you more control. The vacuum will be available for purchase starting February 10, 2025. However, a presale event is already open on the Eufy Store until February 9, when you can get $50 off the regular price.

Irene is an experienced writer with four years in the Tech, E-commerce, and Food niches. She currently writes for Talk Android and Android Police, where she geeks out about the latest innovative practices, solutions, and gadgets. When not writing, Irene embraces her inner couch potato, finding joy in gaming, singing, music, and of course, eating.
